algorithm

Class Breed

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithm.Breed

  • public abstract class Breed
extends java.lang.Object
    Applies the crossover and mutation operation to chromosomes which are bred. For each breeding session two chromosomes are always selected and the respective operation of crossover, or mutation are applied to the parents.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(java.util.Random random)
        Initialize the breeding selection with a uniform random number

      • inBreeding

        public static void inBreeding(boolean inBred)
        Increases the amount of genetic mutations that occur, which is usually as a result of in-breeding in genetics. This simulates the negative effects of in-breeding within a population and increases the mutation rate by 5% each time up to a maximum threshold value, otherwise if the population is not in-bred the amount of mutation decreases down to the original mutation rate of 1%. If the population is in-bred the amount of genetic mutation that occur increases, whereas if the amount of in-breeding is minimal the amount of genetic mutations that occurs is minimized.

      • cloning

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Chromosome> cloning(Selection selection)
        Performs the cloning operation which simply returns the pair of parent chromosomes, these parents continue on to the next generation.
        Parameters:
        selection - The selection iterator containing the chromosomes to be selected.
        Returns:
        The pair of parent chromosomes

      • crossover

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Chromosome> crossover(Selection selection)
        Performs the crossover operation on the parent chromosomes and returns a pair of chromosomes.
        Parameters:
        selection - The selection iterator containing the chromosomes to be selected.
        Returns:
        A pair of chromosomes that have had crossover

      • mutation

        public static Chromosome mutation(Chromosome chromosome)
        Performs the mutation operation on the parent chromosomes and returns a pair of mutated child chromosomes.
        Parameters:
        selection - The selection iterator containing the chromosomes to be selected.
        Returns:
        A pair of mutated chromosomes
